summary: The Veterans' Surviving Spouse Equity Act of 2025 aims to expand eligibility for certain benefits administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to surviving spouses of veterans who were rated totally disabled at the time of their death. The bill amends Title 38 of the United States Code, specifying that eligibility extends to spouses married to the veteran for at least one year before death or cohabitating and presenting as spouses for at least one year before death, regardless of other marriages.
